description: several white flowers with wide petals, and thin white filaments with orange tips; long broad green leaves behind flowers, with a dark blue background
inscription: LLC, in margin, in pencil: White Ginger
provenance: [Steven Thomas, Woodstock Vt., until 2017, sold to Kinney]; Marla J. Kinney, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2019.
signed: bottom right edge, in margin, in pencil: Shirley Russell
text: White Ginger is one of several tropical flower prints Shirley Russell created in collaboration with Japanese publisher Watanabe Shōzaburō. The fragrant white ginger grew like a weed in Honolulu, Hawaii, where Russell lived for 60 years, supporting herself as a high school art teacher. According to Japanese printmaking tradition, a separate carver and printer executed this woodcut after Russell’s design.
title: White Ginger
